body:
Comment 6 by **notan.kdev**: 
64 Bits of TAI in a granularity of 0.1µs (spans more than 50 thousand years).
100 nanoseconds is fine enough for any timeout.
TAI has no problems with leap seconds.
Calculation UTC from TAI is manageable for a Processor that can manager 64 Bit integers.
Representing the year in the upper 16 bit and use 48 bits for .1µs within the year,
causes subtle bugs around midnight new year, when I want to party without IT calling
me for a problem.
